intro: Anemidictyon phyllitidis var. longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved anemidictyon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It is typically found in moist, sandy soils in coastal areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies of coastal vegetation.
